title: Google reveals Pixel 4 and several other gadgets at New York event
text:
The Google Pixel 4 comes in Clearly White, Just Black and Oh So Orange (Google)

Google has announced its latest premium Pixel smartphone in an attempt to challenge the likes of Apple’s iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro.

The phone, which had been the subject of numerous leaks, includes several new features and an improved camera system.

As in previous years, the new Pixel will come in a standard 5.7-inch size and a larger ‘XL’ variant with a 6.3-inch screen and larger battery.

Google confirmed several details of the Pixel 4 in social media leaks before today’s event in New York City. As such, many tech fans knew to expect the facial recognition technology and dual-lens camera before it was announced.

The Pixel 4 and Pixel 4 XL will come in a choice of three different colours: Just Black, Clearly White and a new Oh So Orange finish.

The new Oh So Orange finish is our favourite (Google)

The on board facial recognition technology uses a motion-sensing radar called Moli that’s looking to compete with Apple’s FaceID system. Google is at pains to point out all the personal information stays on the phone and isn’t transmitted to its servers. The company also says its technology can go further than what Apple offers.

The Pixel 4 has what Google calls ‘Motion Sense’ which allows people to swipe their hand in front of the screen and execute a command without actually touching it. So, hypothetically, you could skip music tracks while you cook dinner without having to smear your greasy fingers across the screen.

‘Pixel 4 will be the first device with Soli, powering our new Motion Sense features to allow you to skip songs, snooze alarms, and silence phone calls, just by waving your hand,’ Google explained.

‘These capabilities are just the start, and just as Pixels get better over time, Motion Sense will evolve as well.’

Pixels have always been known for their photographic ability and this latest model adds an extra lens for the first time. The standard 12-megapixel camera has been joined by a 16-megapixel telephoto one while the front-facing shooter remains the same 8-megapixel one from the Pixel 3.

Google stole a march on Apple’s Night Mode by announcing Night Sight (a camera mode that brightens darker pictures) for the Pixel 3 last year. Twelve months on and Google is pushing ‘astrophotography’ with a new mode on the Pixel 4 dedicated to capturing the night sky – whether or not you’ve got the phone settled on a tripod.

Part of the Pixel 4’s allure will be the software perks – the phones will come with Android 10 pre-installed and will be the first to receive security and software updates. Both devices also use cutting-edge Snapdragon 855 processors and have 6GB of RAM. There’s a choice of either 64GB or 128GB of storage space depending on how much you want to spend.

Alongside the new phones, Google also revealed an updated version of the Home Mini smart speaker. Like the company’s other smart speakers, this now falls under the ‘Nest’ branding to fit in with other smart home gadgets like thermostats and smoke detectors.

The Nest Mini smart speaker now comes in ‘Coral’ to match the phone (Google)

MORE: What is Google Stadia? – When is it out and how much will it cost?

The new Nest Home Mini (which costs £49) has been given a few extra features – capacitive controls on the felt-covered surface and a couple of new LEDs to indicate volume controls. There’s also a recessed hole in the back of it so you can wall mount it on a nail. And, naturally, the audio is louder and clearer than last year’s model.

There was also an updated version of Google WiFi – the mesh networking system the tech giant first announced back in 2016. The look of the router and the beacons has been given an overhaul (they’re now even more white and minimalist) and the company’s Google Assistant has been added to the beacons, which can now double up as smart speakers in their own right.

Google WiFi has been given an even more minimalist look – if that were possible (Google)

Finally, Google also revealed a new laptop, the 13.3-inch Pixelbook Go. It boasts Intel processors and a choice of either 8GB or 16GB of RAM.

Advertisement

Like the previous Pixelbook, it will run Google’s own ChromeOS and has the Google Assistant built in.

The bottom of the Pixelbook Go has a unique textured finish to avoid it slipping around while it’s on your lap or a desk. It will come in two colours: Just Black and Not Pink.

UK pricing starts at £669 for the Pixel 4 and £829 for the Pixel 4 XL and both will be available from October 24. You can check out the full Google event as it unfolded in the video below.
